item.title: From fragmented notes to structured
item.description: I create notes primarily in two ways. Using an org-capture template that captures the note as a subheading and gets refiled to inbox.org which would then get reviewed and may become a note on my system if it has value. I create a new note file skipping going to the inbox. Once a note is created and or converted to a file it exists in my Zettelkasten system.

item.title: Thoughts on note creation for personal system
item.description: When notes are created they need to be reviewed, there is no easy way to review a note so I think rather than creating multiple files that may be empty I may initially create the note as a subtree, once it’s capture i determine if it’s worthwile expanding to when it then becomes a file. The file that is created should also add the relationship with org-brain Related External Links

item.title: Building a second brain
item.description: GTD: Capture, track, and spread tasks across projects Progressive Summarizing: Make past research easy to pick up and add value to in small chunks over time P.A.R.A (Projects, Areas, Reference, Archive): Store notes over the long term, in simple categories designed to surface them when most actionable Just-In-Time Project Management: Create the conditions for rapidly executing and delivering projects using existing assets.
